intro: Englerodendron macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered englerodendron, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Englerodendron macranthum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
